title: Enable Digital Governance
description:
1\. No platforms for groups to form consensus and govern themselves in their liking 

2\. Corruption in governance

f6_assessments.q0:
I love the student-centric approach. These are exactly the kind of initiatives we need to create African heroes and success stories.

Burkina Faso is a tough environment. Should this be successful it would stand out from the "ordinary" stories you'd expect to hear from a country as poor as Burkina Faso.

If you manage to pull this off and wish to expand, I have some contacts in the neighboring Benin, too.
f6_assessments.q1:
This is a really ambitious proposal with a concise plan, almost too concise. I'm left wanting for more details:
- How many students? What profile?
- What is the road map and timeline?
- What are the proposers' credentials and experience?
- What team in India? What will they do?
- How about the team in US? Who are they?

If you need translation assistance, please ask WADA or turn to the community advisors. We will find a way to help.
f6_assessments.q2:
To be granted 50K you need to provide a little bit more meat around the bones. If you are not data-restricted, please create a video or a pitch deck (slides) and answer the questions above.

If you don't get funded now, please work on the proposal and come back in Fund7. It's a really good approach.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal did a great job of highlighting a problem with a implementable Solution, but what is lacking here is depth.
The Solution isn't clearly explained especially about how it address the challenge problem.
The proposal will require lots of research before implementation and this aspect was completely omitted.
Most of the solutions presented can be achieved using Atala Prism (https://atalaprism.io/app) and there is no indication on how this solution is different from what Atala prism already provides, this was lost due to the lack of more detail to the proposed solution.
With more details , this will be a great idea.
Considering the above , i do not agree the proposal effectively address the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal clearly details the lack of experience to execute this proposal (To goal of this proposal is to offer African students of computer science a paid opportunity to gain real development on a potentially high impact project.).
There is no implementation plan , no cost breakdown or timelines provided.

I strongly disagree that the proposal will be implemented or the necessary experience shown to bring it to success.
f6_assessments.q2:
There is absolutely no information to guide the audit of the project success. This proposal feels unfinished .
I strongly disagree.

f6_assessments.q0: As this proposal has already stated different participating entities in Africa, it will definitely help those teams to grow the local developer community and ensure secure governance in Africa while growing the Cardano community.
f6_assessments.q1: The project seems well planned and is already past its initial idea phase. The market idea is reasonable and the milestones feasible. Even if the stated overall goal may not be achieved, the work on this project itself will already successfully fulfill the purpose of this challenge.
f6_assessments.q2: All necessary information is given on how to rate the success. One could add as a first milestone, to get the Afrika - India - USA collaboration running and develop the planned governance tool.

f6_assessments.q0: While according to the plan, some african developers might benefit from the project by finding work, the effect on the challenge beyond this factorremains unexplained.
f6_assessments.q1: The plan is kind of coarse-grained and there is not a lot of information on the team behind it. THe budget remains unexplained.
f6_assessments.q2: some auditable key metrics are presented, however they are not very detailed. A dedicated, detailed plan for the project and proper explanation of the idea is missing.

solution:
1\. Launch platform to allow groups to create various governance structures

2\. Transparency via the public ledger
experience: Partial development of web platform exists
